summary: access control of prior feed versions are frozen as of the state when the version was created
description: when a new version of a feed is created in modeshape the access control to that feed's node tree is frozen as of the state it was in at that point in time
if a is later granted access to that feed it only affects the current feed version
therefore the user will not be able to view the prior version since it still has the older access control state
i don't believe there is a way to change that frozen state

the easiest fix i can think of right now is when viewing a feed's version history if permission check for read access to the current feed version succeeds then a separate query would be made for the feed's prior versions in a privileged service mode that bypasses the access control restrictions
we may also want to consider having access to a feed's history as a new kind of permission that can be granted

summary: granting feed details permissions grants permanent category access

the problem is that there is not an easy way to determine when this category access can be revoked when the feed's access is revoked as there may be other feeds the user still has access to under that category
we should either figure out a way to revoke these category access rights when necessary have a way to show the user that these access right exists
i don't know how high the priority of this should be

summary: enhance executesparkjob processor spark app parameter configuration
description: as we add the support for combining the functionality of multiple spark apps into a single executesparkjob processor to share a single spark supplying all of the arguments required by each of the apps would become more complex if we only support a singe arguments field on the processor
currently we would have to supply a union of all arguments in that field which besides being hard to maintain may cause conflicts between the apps
one solution is to simply force a designer to create a new facade spark app with its own argument list that calls the other apps to combine the functionality
this is cumbersome and can be a deployment headache

perhaps a better solution would be to allow additional optional properties to be added to the executesparkjob processor that allows the designer to indicate the chain of apps that should be run in the one context and to specify the arguments needed by each configured app

summary: tables cannot be previewed in the catalog based upon different databases
description: teradata tables and postgres tables dont render within the catalog preview and catalog query tabs
this is because each database has different syntax that works when querying records

ideas to fix this create a new factory that generates the proper select with limit based upon the database type databasetype databasetype.frommetadata(conn create new rest endpoints a with queryparam(limit will generate the correct preview select from above and run it and return the results b this will just return the correct sql for the preview sql and return it modify the preview tab to call the new modify the query tab to fill in the query in the editor with the example error thrown for teradata preview and query tabs is below

teradata doesnt support limit clause error toresponse caught throwable org.springframework.jdbc.badsqlgrammarexception statementcallback bad sql grammar select from limit nested exception is teradata database terajdbc error sqlstate syntax error expected something between the word and the limit keyword

summary: teradata catalog doesnt show

currently it is only going into listcatalogs it should do something like

summary: cannot view csv table created in visual query

summary: date standardizer fails when converting an instant in time zone offset transition
description: in timezone asia/novosibirsk the time is invalid because it is in a time zone offset transition period
the standardizer cannot convert that date on a system in that timezone when it should be able to in some cases

standardize the format with a output format of in this case an incoming date of is clearly meant to represent the date in question and should be convertible to hive date format in other cases converting from format for example to format datetime or datetime_nomillis should not be attempted because you could only do so by adding time to account for the clock change
in this case we should not standardize bad data
steps to reproduce launch kylo sandbox ami set timezone via timedatectl asia/novosibirsk and reboot instance
create a feed for userdata sample data with a standardizer to convert from format to create a sample data file from first few rows of and change a row birthdate to be copy the file to the dropzone
wait for the feed to complete the run on the input file
note that the row will be invalid in the profile view
expected result row should be valid

this happens because in the function generatemergenonpartitionquerywithdedupe in file tablemergesyncsupport.java there is the control having this check avoid the correct insert of data because for vanessa the count is this bug can be solved by add a group by for the second part of the query union all select selectsql

summary: data overwrite in mergetable processor
description: when using dedupe merge strategy on partitioned table it can happen that when flow files containing new data for same partition of a same feed are run at the same time in mergetable processor the one which is processed last will overwrite new data added by the one which finished first

scenario create feed with dedupe and merge strategy and at least one partition run initial ingestion with some data initdata which will go to partition x prepare files and to be ingested separately for the same feed should be big enough to make mergetable processor run for a while should contain data for partition x stop mergetable processor in flow until there are flow files for both input files in its queue start mergetable processor once ingestion is done the final count of rows in master table will be wrong instead of initdata it will be either initdata or initdata depending on which flow file finished last
possible solution add option to mergetable processor to block running flow files for the same feed can be based on merge strategy or setting

summary: the modeshape type feedsla should be defined explicitly in the cnd schema
description: currently the type feedsla which defines the relationship between an sla and one or more feeds is created programatically if not present when modeshape starts up
this is different from how all other metadata types are defined
this type can easily be defined in our cnd file modeshape schema since it is only created once if it already exist
this programmatic creation obscures where the type comes from and may interfere with our ability to upgrade types in the future

summary: research possiblity of registering other custom datasources and use in wrangler and feeds
description: we support custom data sources that create jdbc controller services

can we extend this to allow users to make other data sources such as hdfs folder location buckets and then use them in feeds or in the wrangler we need to discuss how this would be modeled and integrated

summary: support remote process group as a kylo template for
description: kylo doesn't have any guide for load balancing on clustered nifi
supporting remote process group is a best way because it is the most common way
but kylo currently doesn't allow configuring remote process group from the kylo ui it is necessary to configure remote process group as a kylo template including node url and input port name
this is very useful to ingest large separated data for example getfile getftp etc

related tasks note only reusable templates can partake in remote process groups register template reusable with input port needs to ask if the template should partake in remote process group if yes kylo needs to create the template instance and also create the input port on the parent nifi flow canvas and connect it into the template instance

kylo may need to store this metadata about the or obtain it from nifi register template with remoteprocessgroup kylo needs to ask the user for the and then scan those locations via a rest call to find any available input ports on the parent nifi flow canvas and present the user the ability to wire them together with the remote group kylo may need to maintain state about this remote process group connection information in addition to it being buried inside the feedmetadata processors json

editing a feed using a template with a remoteprocessgroup should allow the user to edit the remoteprocessgroup connection properties if one option would be to convert the remoteprocessgroup properties into kylo nifiproperty object so the ui could just render it lik any other processor properties

summary: jaas loginmodule flag property should be consistent in all kylo auth configs
description: these flags control the rules by which multiple loginmodules may be combined to control login
right now the configuration properties for the loginmodules provided by kylo are not named consistently nor do all loginmodules support their configuration
this should be cleaned up

summary: refactor categories to no longer use the extensible types
description: the current implementation of categories is using the extensible type mechanism to add user properties the to category instances
this has complicated things since entity access control has been added to kylo because modeshape is to require admin privileges to change the type system and users are allowed to add user properties
categories should be refactored to use something similar to our current custom property support to manage user properties instead of creating new category subtypes that define these properties

summary: functional and entity access checks for templates

summary: removing oneself from and admin role prevents role membership changes

the error though is obscure
we need to decide what is the best action in this case
